options: It is the way a computer is designed and structured.

description.html: What is a hardware computer?

explanation.html: Computer hardware is the physical parts or components of a computer, such as the monitor, mouse, keyboard,computer data storage, hard disk drive (HDD), graphic cards, sound cards, memory, motherboard, and so on, all of which are physical objects that are tangible. So it is the collection of all the physical parts of a computer.

explanation.html: The computer case is the metal and plastic box that contains the main components of the computer, including the motherboard, central processing unit (CPU), and power supply. The front of the case usually has an On/Off button and one or more optical drives.

description.html:

Step 3 Select the template you'd like to use for your brochure.

State whether the above statement is relevant or irrelevant.

5. Share your brochures as needed (for example, to collaborate with coworkers or to provide a sample to a client), just as you would share any Google Docs file.

Is this statement valid or invalid?

Steps how to customise a brochure template in Google Docs .

Are these steps correct?

1. Click "File" from the menu bar, then click "Page Setup."

2. Select your desired page orientation from the popup window ("Landscape" for horizontal formatting).

3. To add multiple columns to your brochure, click "Format" and then hover over "Columns" to choose a two- or three-column setup.

4. You'll likely need to make adjustments to your template, like editing text or moving graphics, so that each element looks right.

How to share a Google Doc.

  1. Go to Google's home page (while signed in) and click the box formed of nine little dots in the top right corner.
  2. Create a document (usually blank) then type in its name in the top left corner, and add as much content as you like.
  3. Scroll down through the apps, then click on the Google Docs app, which looks like a piece of blue paper with white lines.
  4. Click the blue button reading "Share" in the top right corner.
  5. Click the pencil icon beside each name if you want to change the way the user can engage with the doc ("Can edit," "Can comment," or just "Can view").
  6. Click "Done."

How to make trifold brochure ?

3. Layout tab select Margins and choose Narrow Margins.

4. Layout tab select Columns and select 3 Columns.
What keys did you use to save?

explanation.html:
1. Option 1 is correct, It saves the current file or document (works in most programs)

2. Option 2 is also correct, Shift + F12 saves the Microsoft Word document (like Ctrl + S )

3. Option 3 is wrong, you will just get a blank screen.

description.html: What keys do you use to exit word?

explanation.html:
1. Opption 1 is correct, Pressing ALT + F4 to close Command Prompt only works on Windows 10.

2. Option 2 is wrong, Shift+F4 Repeat the last “Find” action.

3. Option 3 is wrong, Ctrl-F is the shortcut in your browser or operating system that allows you to find words or phrases quickly.

description.html: What keys do you use to select all?

explanation.html: 2. Option 2 is correct, To perform a function on all the content in the text editor, you need to select it all. Place the cursor anywhere in the text editor and press CTRL+A.

description.html: What keys do you use to open a new document?

explanation.html:
1. Option 1 is correct, Ctrl+N is a keyboard shortcut most often used to create a new document, window, workbook, or other type of file.

2. Option 2 is wrong, You primarily use the Shift key on your keyboard when you want to type capital letters.

3. Option 3 is wrong, Alt+N is a keyboard shortcut most often used to open the Insert option in a file menu

description.html: What keys do you use to redo the last action?

explanation.html:
1. Option 1 is wrong, pressing Ctrl+R aligns the line.

2. Option 2 is wrong, Ctrl+P is a keyboard shortcut most often used to print a document or page.

3. Option 3 is correct, To reverse your last Undo, press CTRL+Y. You can reverse more than one action that has been undone. You can use Redo command only after Undo command.

description.html: What keys do you use to undo the last thing you did?

explanation.html:
1. Option 1 is wrong, pressing Ctrl-u deletes text you've typed in the current line.

2. Option 2 is wrong, Ctrl + L Aligns the line.

3. Option 3 is correct, To reverse your last action, press CTRL+Z. You can reverse more than one action.

description.html: What keys do you use to underline the text?

explanation.html:
1. Option 1 is wrong, It used to cut selected text and save it to the clipboard ready to paste elsewhere.

2. Option 2 is correct, pressing Ctrl-u deletes text you've typed in the current line.

3. Option 3 is wrong, To reverse your last action, press CTRL+Z. You can reverse more than one action.

description.html: What key do you use to check the spelling?

explanation.html: Option 3 is correct, The F7 key is the only key commonly used to spell check and grammar check a document in Microsoft programs such as Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Outlook, and other Office products.

description.html: What keys do you use the paste?

explanation.html:
1. Option 1 is wrong, Ctrl+P is a keyboard shortcut most often used to print a document or page.

2. Option 2 is wrong, typically used to cut selected text and save it to the clipboard ready to paste elsewhere.

3. Option 3 is correct, Control (Ctrl) + V. Remember "V" as. The PASTE command is used to place the information that you have stored on your virtual clipboard in the location that you have placed your mouse cursor.

description.html: What keys do you use to change the font?

explanation.html: Option 1 is correct, It is the only key used to Change the font.

description.html: What keys do you use to cut text or pictures?

explanation.html: Option 1 is correct, Ctrl+X is a keyboard shortcut most often used to cut a selected section of text, image, or other object.

description.html: What keys do you use to copy something?

explanation.html:
1. Option 1 is wrong, typically used to cut selected text and save it to the clipboard ready to paste elsewhere.

2. Option 2 is wrong, To reverse your last action, press CTRL+Z. You can reverse more than one action.

3. Option 3 is correct.

description.html: What keys do you use the make the text bold?

explanation.html: Option 1 is correct, Ctrl+B is a keyboard shortcut most often used to toggle bold text on and off.

description.html: What keys do you use the select or highlight part of the text?

explanation.html: Option 3 is correct, It is the only key used to scroll to the start and end of each range while selecting the ranges before stopping at the end of the worksheet, press CTRL+SHIFT+an arrow key. Press SCROLL LOCK, and then use the UP ARROW key or DOWN ARROW key to scroll one row up or down.

description.html: What keys do you use to move the curser around your text?

explanation.html: Option 2 is correct, Arrow keys or cursor movement keys are buttons on a computer keyboard that are either programmed or designated to move the cursor in a specified direction.

description.html: Why is work experience important for FE students?

explanation.html: Option 1 is correct, One of the most important benefits of work experience is its potential to provide opportunities for students to learn more about their own abilities. It helps them explore their strengths and weaknesses and identify the gaps in their skills

options: A letter that goes in front of your CV to make it look nice
A letter you send with your CV to outline more information about you.
A letter you send with your CV to outline more information about you and why you are applying for the role.
A letter you send with your CV to outline why you are sending your CV.

description.html: What is a covering letter?

explanation.html: Option 3 is correct, A cover letter, also known as a covering letter or application letter, is a one-page document that introduces a job seeker's work history, professional skills, and personal interest in applying for a job. Although it might seem old-fashioned in 2021, cover letters are still necessary.

options: To outline your experience and knowledge to prospective employers
So that employers know who you are when you go to interview
To outline your previous experience, work places and education to a prospective employer

description.html: Why do you use a CV?
What does CV stand for?

explanation.html: Option 3 is correcr, Curriculum Vitae (CV) is Latin for "course of life." In contrast, resume is French for "summary." Both CVs & Resumes: Are tailored for the specific job/company you are applying to.

description.html: Cover letters are generally _____ page at most in length.

options: Simply copy and paste the same letter over and over.
Create an original letter for each job application.
Copy and paste the first and last paragraphs, but tailor the rest to the employer.

description.html: When writing your cover letter, you should:

explanation.html: Option 2 is correct, It is necessary to create original letter for each particular job that shows that you are interested on that job.

description.html: What must be included in a cover letter?

explanation.html: Option 4 is coreect, When writing a cover letter, specific information needs to be included: a contact section, a salutation, an introduction to the hiring manager, information on why you are qualified for the job, a closing, and your signature. The way the information is listed and the format depend on how you are sending your letter.

description.html: A cover letter can be handwritten

explanation.html: Option 2 is correct, The only place handwriting should appear on the cover letter is your signature. Handwriting a cover letter shows a lack of interest in the position, especially in a technological era where computers are easily accessible.

options: A specific person (ex. Mr. Smith, Director of Marketing)

description.html: Your cover letter should be addressed to:

explanation.html: Option 3 is correct, If you don't know that person use some variation of, "Dear Software Team Hiring Manager." You can also use, "Dear Hiring Manager" if the addressee really is unknown. Remember that "To Whom It May Concern" is an old-fashioned salutation for cover letters

description.html: It's ok to have spelling and grammar mistakes in your CV

explanation.html: Option 2 is correct, They're particularly damaging because they convey to potential employers that an applicant lacks attention to detail.

description.html: Employers usually look at a CV for 2 minutes.

explanation.html: Option 2 is correct, That may be optional it depends on the read that's why you need to have a CV that have two pages, a maximum of three. Make use of bullet points and write in short sharp sentences. Don't waffle. Focus on job content

explanation.html:
1. option 1 is correct, Click the image that you want to edit. Image options will appear on the editor toolbar.

Click Filter. Options will appear on the editor side panel. Click on a filter to apply it to the image. Adjust the Intensity level to your liking.

description.html: What does the important thing you need to remember when designing in Canva?
Replacing an existing template with a new one will overwrite whatever is on the page.
1. What does CSS stand for?

explanation.html: Option 2 is correct, CSS is the acronym of “Cascading Style Sheets”. CSS is a computer language for laying out and structuring web pages (HTML or XML).

description.html: 2. What term describes one specific feature such as size or color?

explanation.html: Option 2 is correct, Since it dictates which aspect of the selector will be changed visually.

options: a. You can add multiple link tags in one document.
b. Allows you to create custom tags to achieve specialized objectives.
c. Allows you to position objects in three dimensions (layers).

description.html: 3. The following are capabilities of CSS except one? Identify it?

explanation.html: Option 1 is correct, You can do that on HTML but not in CSS.

description.html: 4. What symbol indicates that numeric values will be hexadecimal instead of decimal?

explanation.html: Option 1 is correct, Decimal numbers make use of 10 symbols from 0 to 9 and its combinations to represent different values. The radix for Hexadecimal number is 16 i.e all the digits in a Hexadecimal number are expressed in terms of powers of 16. ... Hexadecimal numbers are more human friendly.

description.html: 5. What element would you style to set default properties for all of the other elements on your web page?

explanation.html: Option 1 is correct, The <head> tag is used to define style information (CSS) for a document. ... If some properties have been defined for the same selector (element) in different style ... <head> Most browsers will display the <head> element with the default values

description.html: 6. Which of the following part of declaration is a property?

explanation.html: Option 3 is correct, Each declaration includes a CSS property name and a value, separated by a colon. Multiple CSS declarations are separated with semicolons, and declaration blocks are surrounded by curly braces.

description.html: 7. Which of the following is NOT a way to apply CSS properties to your website?

explanation.html: Option 3 is correct, The outline CSS shorthand property set all the outline properties in a single declaration.

description.html: 8. Which of the following lines of code will correctly set the color of text inside a <h3> element to Grey, when found in an external CSS file?

explanation.html: Option 4 is correct, An external stylesheet is a standalone . css file that is linked from a web page. Inline styles relate to a specific HTML tag, using a style attribute with a CSS rule to style a specific page element.

description.html: 9. What special element will tell the browser the location of the CSS file?

explanation.html: Option 1 is correct, we only use a link tag to access any location on the browser.

options: a. makes every "p" text character on the web page grey
b.  Creates a web page with a grey background
c. defines a grey color for text inside a paragraph element
d. creates grey text anywhere "text/css" appears on the web page

description.html:
10. What does this code do?

<style type="text/css">p{color: grey;}

explanation.html: Option 3 is correct, it shows you exactly what is it, that is more like you are given an answer.

description.html: 11. What symbols are used in external CSS files to create a comment?

options: a. it helps create unique web pages
b. it allows for the separation of style and content
c. it change the structure of the web page

description.html: 12. Why use CSS?
12. The style declaration block consists of what?

explanation.html: Option 1 is correct, Each declaration includes a CSS property name and a value, separated by a colon. Multiple CSS declarations are separated with semicolons, and declaration blocks are surrounded by curly braces.

options: a. allows to substitute the selected attribute
b. selects which element to style

description.html: 13. In the rule, the "selector":

explanation.html: Option 2 is corect, the selector is simply the element that is linked to a particular style.

description.html: 14. An ID selector is represented by a symbol of?

explanation.html: Option 1 is correct, The #id selector allows you to target an element by referencing the id HTML attribute. Similar to how class attributes are denoted in CSS with a “period” ( . ) before the class name, ID attributes are prefixed with an “octothorpe” ( # ), more commonly known as a “hash” or “pound sign”

description.html: 15. Classes can be used only once in a web page.?
16. This indicate how the elements referred to in the selector should be styled.

explanation.html: Option 1 is correct, selector { property: value; } You can list as many declarations as you want. A group of declarations are called a declaration block . selector { property: value; property: value; }

description.html: 17. What is "style" when you use it in an internal CSS?

explanation.html: Option 2 is correct, The <style> tag is used to define style information (CSS) for a document. Inside the <style> element you specify how HTML elements should render in a browser.

description.html: 18. What is the format if you want to create font color green style for an ID selector in a <div> tag?
19. The background color of the content also covers:

explanation.html: Option 3 is correct, Since padding creates extra space within an element. In contrast, margin creates extra space around an element so it can not be option a or others.

description.html: 20. if an element is positioned has no positioned ancestors, it uses the document body, and moves along with page scrolling.

explanation.html: Option 4 is correct, An element with position: absolute; is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor (instead of positioned relative to the viewport, like fixed). However; if an absolute positioned element has no positioned ancestors, it uses the document body, and moves along with page scrolling.
